page.title: 13Coddenham Area Schooling
page.content: The village school in Coddenham closed 15 years ago. It dated back to the 18th Century when it was charitably endowed "for teaching 15 poor boys of Coddenham to read, write and cast accounts and the girls knitting and sewing also". today transport is provided to take 5-11yr olds to a CofE school in Stonham Aspal 4 miles away. There is a Playgroup at the School and Mother and Toddler Group in Crowfield village 2\ miles away. Hemingstone school is also closed and 5-11yr olds are transported to a school in Henley nearby where there is also a Playgroup. At 11yrs most children in our block travel by the school bus to Claydon High School 3 miles away. The Suffolk College of Higher and Further Education in Ipswich can be the next step. Private education is available in Ipswich and Stowmarket.
